comments:
I ran into the following exception on M9 preventing the new runtime wizard from launching.  I created a TomCat 5.5 runtime, where I was warned about a JDK version. After creating the runtime, I hit "new" again because the runtime field was not filled, and the exception appeard.

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: 
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.Assert.isLegal(Assert.java:58)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.Assert.isLegal(Assert.java:42)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Status.setMessage(Status.java:174)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Status.<init>(Status.java:81)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.internal.FacetCorePlugin.log(FacetCorePlugin.java:49)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.runtime.internal.RuntimeManagerImpl.notifyRuntimeListeners(RuntimeManagerImpl.java:261)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.runtime.internal.RuntimeManagerImpl.bridge(RuntimeManagerImpl.java:391)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.runtime.internal.RuntimeManagerImpl.getRuntimes(RuntimeManagerImpl.java:134)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.project.facet.core.runtime.RuntimeManager.getRuntimes(RuntimeManager.java:92)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.componentcore.datamodel.FacetProjectCreationDataModelProvider.getValidPropertyDescriptors(FacetProjectCreationDataModelProvider.java:189)
	at org.eclipse.wst.common.frameworks.internal.datamodel.DataModelImpl.getValidPropertyDescriptors(DataModelImpl.java:318)
	at org.eclipse.wst.web.ui.internal.wizards.DataModelFacetCreationWizardPage.launchNewRuntimeWizard(DataModelFacetCreationWizardPage.java:60)
	at org.eclipse.wst.web.ui.internal.wizards.DataModelFacetCreationWizardPage$1.widgetSelected(DataModelFacetCreationWizardPage.java:96)
	at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.TypedListener.handleEvent(TypedListener.java:90)
I fixed the assert/IllegalArgumentException, so now the real exception should be visible.
This change is a bulk update of all _un_targeted, fixed, resolved bugs upon release of M5. This particular bug _might_ have been fixed earlier than M5. (Feel free to correct).

This bug is being moved to the "closed" state since it has been in the fixed state for a so long it is being assumed fixed, without explicit verification from the originator. If there is still a problem, in the most recent 1.5.x builds, please reopen or open another bug.
